results.title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg, Supreme Court’s Feminist Icon, Is Dead at 87
results.abstract: The second woman appointed to the Supreme Court, Justice Ginsburg’s pointed and powerful dissenting opinions earned her late-life rock stardom.

media.caption: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was the leader of the court’s four-member liberal wing.Credit...

results.byline: By Ana Swanson, David McCabe and Jack Nicas
results.title: Trump Administration to Ban TikTok and WeChat From U.S. App Stores
results.abstract: It issued new rules that will cripple the operation of two popular Chinese-owned apps in the United States.

media.caption: The Trump administration said it would bar TikTok and WeChat from U.S. app stores as of Sunday night.

results.title: Emails Detail Effort to Silence C.D.C. and Question Its Science
results.abstract: Emails from a former top Trump health official and his science adviser show how the two refused to accept Centers for Disease Control and Prevention science and sought to silence the agency.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Michael R. Caputo, the Department of Health and Human Services’s top spokesman, went on medical leave this week, days after he attacked C.D.C. scientists in a bizarre Facebook video.

results.title: C.D.C. Testing Guidance Was Published Against Scientists’ Objections
results.abstract: A controversial guideline saying people without Covid-19 symptoms didn’t need to get tested for the virus came from H.H.S. officials and skipped the C.D.C.’s scientific review process.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: The C.D.C. headquarters in Atlanta. Officials said the agency’s parent organization, the Department of Health and Human Services, inserted guidance on the C.D.C. website over its scientists’ strenuous objections.
media.copyright: Audra Melton for The New York Times

results.title: What Happened Inside Ed Buck’s Apartment?
results.abstract: Two men died of meth overdoses at the home of a West Hollywood political donor. Dark conspiracy theories abounded— but the truth is even darker.

results.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Maggie Haberman
results.title: A Deal on Drug Prices Undone by White House Insistence on ‘Trump Cards’
results.abstract: The White House and the pharmaceutical industry were nearing a major deal to lower drug prices. Then the administration demanded that $100 cash cards be sent to millions of seniors before the election — and the industry balked.

results.title: Virus Pulls Down Trump, Poll Shows, and G.O.P. Senators Suffer With Him
results.abstract: A New York Times/Siena College survey showed Joe Biden leading President Trump by wide margins in Maine and Arizona, and effectively tied in North Carolina. Susan Collins trailed her Democratic rival in Maine’s Senate race.

results.title: McConnell Vows Vote on Ginsburg Replacement as Her Death Upends the 2020 Race
